context: The word 'rühma' is the partitive case form of 'rühm', which means 'group' or 'team'. In Estonian grammar, the partitive case is used to indicate partialness or indefiniteness. So 'rühma' would translate as '(of) a group' or '(in) a group'. This form typically appears after prepositions like 'sees' (in), 'koos' (with/together with), or when indicating belonging to an organization.
